channel.title: Hives on VitaminDWiki
channel.description: Recent content in Hives on VitaminDWiki

item.title: Infant allergy to cow’s milk will go away if have high levels of vitamin D
item.description:
The Establishment of Cow’s Milk Protein Allergy in Infants is Related with a Deficit of Regulatory T cells (Treg) and Vitamin D.

Pediatr Res. 2017 Jan 18. doi: 10.1038/pr.2017.12. [Epub ahead of print]

García LP1, Muñoz JL2, Alonso-Lebrero E3, Reula ES2,4, Pion M2, Correa-Rocha R2.

  • 1Department of Bioactivity and Food Analysisof theCIAL-CSIC, Madrid (Spain).

  • 2Laboratory of Immune-regulation, Hospital General Universitario Gregorio Marañón and Instituto de Investigación Sanitaria Gregorio Marañón (IiSGM), Madrid (Spain).

item.title: Woman with rare allergy to vitamin D was desensitized in a single day
item.description:
Successful Desensitization to Vitamin D in a Patient With Vitamin D Deficiency.

J Investig Allergol Clin Immunol. 2016;26(6):392-393. doi: 10.18176/jiaci.0108.

Unal D1, Coskun R1, Demir D1, Gelincik A1, Colakoglu B1, Buyukozturk S1.

  • Overview Rare Allergic reaction to vitamin D which has the following section

    • Perspective: 3X more likely to be allergic to Aspirin than to Vitamin D

  • Some people have problems with vitamin D

item.title: Sunlight - not too much and not too little
item.description:
Sun is needed, but as with ice cream, getting too much can cause problems – Aug 2015

Go ahead, soak up some sun (but don’t burn) – Holick July 2015

Overly restrictive sun exposure warnings pose health risk - July 2015

Less sun means more disease -Grant, Holick, Cannell, et al Feb 2015

Vitamin D from the sun while minimizing skin cancer - Interview by Dr. Mercolla of Dr. Cannell - Nov 2014

item.title: Vitamin D papers from European Vitamin D Association Conference
item.description:
Most of the ENGLISH presentations of the conference follow

Polish Presentations and Polish abstracts are in the [dl3144]

Graphics and table are generally in the [dl3144]

References are generally in the [dl3144] as well

      • Vitamin D Update 2015: What We Need to Know about Its Health Benefits and Potential for Toxicity?

      • Nutritional Rickets - global guidelines for prevention and treatment
      • The role of vitamin D supplementation in treating health conditions and diseases common among those with intellectual and/or developmental disabilities
      • [Vitamin D in dermatologists’ practice] English abstract

      • Vitamin D and melanoma
      • Potential use of vitamin D analogs in the treatment of skin diseases
      • Biomarkers of Vitamin D Metabolism: Current State of Knowledge

item.title: Hives treatment augmented by 60,000 IU Vitamin D weekly – RCT
item.description:
Chronic urticaria merits serum vitamin D evaluation and supplementation; a randomized case control study

World Allergy Organ J. 2015 Jun 4;8(1):15. doi: 10.1186/s40413-015-0066-z. eCollection 2015.

Rasool R1, Masoodi KZ2, Shera IA1, Yosuf Q1, Bhat IA1, Qasim I1, Nissar S1, Shah ZA1.

Department of Immunology and Molecular Medicine, Sher-i- Kashmir Institute of Medical Sciences, Soura, Srinagar, J&K 190011 India.

2Division of Biotechnology, Sher-e-Kashmir University of Agricultural Sciences and Technology of Kashmir, Srinagar, J&K 190025 India.

item.title: Kawasaki disease (strawberry tongue) associated with very low vitamin D
item.description:
• KD has had a recent seasonal cycle
      • VitaminDWiki reasons to suspect that KD can be prevented with Vitamin D supplementation
      • Snips from Wikipedia entry – with VitaminDWiki comments
      • References
  • Introduction to Kawasaki Disease: Discover About This Illness That Primarily Affects Children Mercola Aug 2018, nice overview, no mention of Vitamin D

KD has had a recent seasonal cycle

which has gotten worse as vitamin D levels have been dropping

Note: the KD season is now in Winter-Spring - when vitamin D levels are the lowest

item.title: Asthma reduced by weekly 50,000 IU of vitamin D – RCT
item.description:
The effects of vitamin D supplementation on airway functions in mild to moderate persistent asthma

Annals of Allergy, Asthma & Immunology DOI: 10.1016/j.anai.2014.07.005

Saba Arshi, MD∗, Morteza Fallahpour, MD fallahpour.morteza@gmail.com , Mohammad Nabavi, MD∗, Mohammad Hasan Bemanian, MD∗, Seyed Ali Javad-Mousavi, MD†, Marzieh Nojomi, MD, MPH‡, Hossein Esmaeilzadeh, MD∗, Rasool Molatefi, MD∗, Mahsa Rekabi, MD∗, Farhad Jalali, PhD∗, Nadieh Akbarpour, PhD∗

Background

Vitamin D is hypothesized to have some roles in innate and adaptive immunity, inflammation reduction, and remodeling; therefore, it is supposed to affect the asthma phenotype, severity, and response to inhaled corticosteroid (ICS).

item.title: Carmel used to color some vitamin D gel caps may cause problems in some people
item.description:
Caramel Allergy-Causes, Symptoms, And Cure

  • Skin hives and eczema patches along with itching.

  • Common cold like symptoms with sneezing, runny nose and rheumy eyes.

  • Breathing trouble which can turn into asthma with noticeable wheezing.

  • Inflammation and puffiness of the facial tissue.

  • Insomnia and severe headaches that can result in migraines.

  • Digestive problems with nausea, vomiting and diarrhea.

  • Severe life threatening symptoms are known as anaphylaxis and can cause the blood pressure to drop suddenly with the patient losing consciousness.

item.title: Vitamin D intervention – 1204 clinical trials
item.description:
Data is US Clinical Trials

There have been more US intervention trials for vitamin D than for vitamins A, C, E, and K combined

D = 1204, vs 1023 = Total A+C+E+K (A =225 + C =340 + E =328 + K =130)

Other statistics for US Vitamin D Intervention trials

  • 802 trials for those 65+

  • 252 trials for children (age 0-17)

  • 1071 trials updated information since Jan 2010

  • 744 trials registered since Jan 2010

item.title: One pill every two weeks gives you all the vitamin D most adults need
item.description:
50,000 IU of Vitamin D once every two weeks proven to prevent/treat:

Diabetes + Heart Failure + Chronic Pain + Depression + Autism + Breast Cancer + Colon Cancer + Prostate Cancer + BPH (prostate) + Preeclampsia + Premature Birth + Falls + Cognitive Decline + Respiratory Tract Infection + Influenza + Tuberculosis + Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease + Lupus + Inflammatory Bowel Syndrome + Urinary Tract Infection + Poor Sleep + Growing Pain + Multiple Sclerosis + PMS + Schizophrenia + Endometriosis + Smoking     27 problems

item.title: Warning – Medicare will pay for just 1 vitamin D test PER LIFETIME (if not related to a few diseases)
item.description:

item.title: Chronic Hives treated by Vitamin D - many studies
item.description:
• Hives (Urticaria) 7X more likely if vitamin D deficient; supplementation helps – meta-analysis April 2021
      • Hives treated by 28,000 IU of Vitamin D weekly – RCT Aug 2020
      • Hives treated by 60,000 IU of Vitamin D every two weeks – RCT May 2020
      • Hives treatment augmented by 60,000 IU Vitamin D weekly – RCT June 2015
      • Beneficial role for supplemental vitamin D3 treatment in chronic urticaria: a randomized study.
      • Vitamin D deficiency 2.5 X more likely with hives - April 2015
      • Chronic Urticaria helped by 300,000 IU of vitamin D monthly Aug 2015
      • Chronic Urticaria alternative treatments include vitamin D - March 2023
      • See also web

Hives (Urticaria) 7X more likely if vitamin D deficient; supplementation helps – meta-analysis April 2021

Hives (Urticaria) 7X more likely if vitamin D deficient, supplementation helps – meta-analysis April 2021

item.title: VitaminDWiki provides answers to Vitamin D questions
item.description:
Vitamin D aids the body in preventing and treating many health problems

    • Deficiency
    • Vitamin D and the Sun
    • Supplementation
    • Diseases and Vitamin D - including proof
    • Vitamin D and Health Professionals
    • History of Vitamin D
    • Additional possible question ideas
    • Possible question ideas from Facts and Myths page
      • Emedicine Vitamin D FAQs May 2012
    • Vitamin D Frequently Asked Questions - 2011
      • Potential Supportive information includes

Deficiency

Which people typically have low levels of Vitamin D?

item.title: Latest Vitamin D Wiki News
item.description:
Vitamin D Workshop June 18-20, 2014      on the web at http://is.gd/VitaminDNews

Notes by Henry Lahore, admin of VitaminDWiki

Video: Does Less Sun mean more Disease? (alternate title:Vitamin D explained in 5 minutes)

  • Versions of the video has been viewed about 20,000 times in 141 countries (mid June 2014)

  • Voice-over in English, German, Swedish, Spanish (Venezuela) (currently)

  • Closed captioned in Portuguese,and Hebrew (currently)

  • Was viewed at the workshop by about 50 people

item.title: Allergic to the sun (Polymorphic light eruption) – you may need UVB or vitamin D
item.description:
• Photosensitivity (sun allergy) and vitamin D in VitaminDWiki
      • Patients with polymorphic light eruption have decreased serum levels of 25-hydroxyvitamin-D3 that increase upon 311 nm UVB photohardening.
      • Wikipedia PLE highlights
      • Clinical trial of Vitamin D to treat PLE – ending Dec 2014
      • Dermatological Phototherapy and Photodiagnostic Methods book
      • Prevention of Polymorphous Light Eruption and Solar Urticaria PLE sunscreens need to block UVA
      • Results of RCT of vitamin D-like compound July 2011
      • Skin hardening effect in patients with PLE: UV hardening in home Jan 2013, < 6 minutes a day.
      • Polymorphic Light Eruption (PLE)
      • http://mysunallergy.com/ compares many ways that a person used to reduce PLE
      • Comments by VitaminDWiki

Photosensitivity (sun allergy) and vitamin D in VitaminDWiki

Photosensitivity (sun allergy) and vitamin D

item.title: Vitamin D for children – translated from Spanish
item.description:
Vitamin D: pathophysiology and clinical applicability in paediatrics

An Pediatr (Barc). 2012; xxx (xx): xxx.e1-xxx.e10

PEDIATRICS ANALESDí www.elsevier.es / anpediatr

R.M. Masvidal Alibercha, S. Gómezb Ortigosa, M.C. Baraza Mendozaa and O. Garcia-Algarb

to Cútala Institut de la Salut, Dr. Lluís Saye CAP, ABS Raval Nord, Barcelona, ??Spain b Department of Pediatrics, Hospital del Mar, Parc de Salut Mar, Barcelona, ??Spain

Received 2 March 2012, accepted May 15, 2012

Summary Vitamin D has always been associated with mineral metabolism, but Vitamin D receptors have been found vitamin D or its metabolites in different cells
